common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting performance issues with Pieces OS, particularly high CPU usage and lag. These issues are often linked to Long Term Memory (LTM) functionality. Suggested solutions include disabling LTM for specific apps, switching to Cloud processing mode, and installing hotfixes. The Pieces team is actively working on resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.

The Pieces team is actively working on long-term solutions, including replacing the LLM stack and releasing hotfixes.

Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
### Software

Desktop Application

Windows

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e730898-a168-4571-ab0d-6331c4d389a4)

i want stop but its not working 

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @msaqibbop reported an issue with the Mistral 8 7b model download button not working and getting stuck on "Initialization".
* User @AkhilTrivediX confirmed the issue and provided a temporary fix involving deleting files and reinstalling.
* Developer @mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and mentioned that the LLM stack is being replaced, which should resolve the problem within 2-3 weeks.

**Problems Identified:**

* Mistral 8 7b model download button not working.
* Download gets stuck on "Initialization" when the button is clicked multiple times.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Temporary fix:** Delete all files from `C:/Users/[YOUR-USERNAME]/Documents/com.pieces.os/` and reinstall Pieces OS and desktop app.
* **Long-term fix:** Replace the LLM stack, which is expected to be completed within 2-3 weeks.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The temporary fix should resolve the issue for users experiencing the download problem.
* The long-term fix is expected to be implemented within 2-3 weeks, which will permanently address the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving performance issues:** The most frequent complaints revolve around Pieces OS performance, particularly high CPU usage linked to Long Term Memory. Focus development efforts on optimizing LTM functionality and resolving these issues to improve user experience.

**Investigate local processing mode:** Several tickets report problems with Pieces Copilot and LTM when in local processing mode. Thoroughly test and debug this mode to ensure its stability and functionality.
**Improve LLM download experience:** Address the bug preventing cancellation of LLM downloads and explore ways to make the download process smoother and more user-friendly.

**Consider a more detailed issue template:** While the current template captures basic information, it could benefit from more specific prompts about LTM settings, processing mode, and steps to reproduce the issue. This would help in diagnosing and resolving issues more efficiently.

**Proactively communicate known issues:** Maintain a visible and updated list of known issues and workarounds on the Pieces website or support forum. This can help users self-resolve common problems and reduce the influx of support tickets.

**Gather more detailed system information:** When users encounter performance issues, automatically collect system specifications (CPU, RAM, OS version) to aid in troubleshooting and identifying potential hardware limitations.

**Analyze ticket trends over time:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and areas where documentation or product improvements are needed. This proactive approach can help prevent future issues and improve overall support efficiency.
